title: Dilara Türk
text:
Dilara Türk (born July 30, 1996) is a <a href="Turks%20in%20Germany">Turkish-German</a> female <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> currently playing in the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga%20%28women%29">German 2. Bundesliga</a> for <a href="1.%20FC%20L%C3%BCbars">1. FC Lübars</a> with jersey number 16. She is part of the <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Turkey women's U-19</a> and <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Turkey women's team</a>.
Family life.
Dilara Türk was born to Turkish immigrant parents in <a href="Kulmbach">Kulmbach</a>, Germany on July 30, 1996. In 2015, she plans to work at the <a href="Frankfurt%20Airport">Frankfurt Airport</a> after her graduation from the vocational school.
Playing career.
Club.
Dilara Türk began her football career at the youth team of <a href="1.%20FC%20N%C3%BCrnberg">1. FC Nürnberg</a>. she played five years in the team, which is the second force in Bavaria at youth level behind <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich%20%28women%29">FC Bayern Munich</a>. She became a member of the Bavaria selection. Considered one of the greatest women's football talents in <a href="Upper%20Franconia">Upper Franconia</a> skilled in speed, technique and overview, she lost her joy for football and took a half-year break from sport. In the summer of 2014, she returned to play in the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga%20%28women%29">German 2. Bundesliga South</a> for <a href="ETSV%20W%C3%BCrzburg">ETSV Würzburg</a>. She capped 17 times in the 2014–15 season. Currently, the midfielder is a member of <a href="1.%20FC%20L%C3%BCbars">1. FC Lübars</a>, which competes also in the German 2. Bundesliga.
International.
At age 13 only in 2010, Dilara Türk's vision was to be a member of the <a href="German%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">German women's national football team</a>.
She was admitted to the <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Turkey women's U-19</a> debuting in the friendly match against Bosnia and Herzegovina on March 17, 2015.
Dilara Türk played the first time for the <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Turkey women's team</a> in the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202017%20qualifying%20Group%205">UEFA Women's Euro 2017 qualifying Group 5</a> match against <a href="Croatia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Croatia</a> on September 17, 2015. She capped in five matches of the tournament.
